AD_ExplosionReaction.synopsis: A goblin guard reacts to an explosion triggered when a player tries to open a rigged cage.

AD_CageOpen.synopsis: The Goblin Heretic reacts to players opening a cage which is rigged to explode.

AD_ReleasedReaction.synopsis: A goblin guard reacts to a caged heretic being freed by calling on allies to attack the player and the heretic

AD_ExplosionReaction_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
AD_ExplosionReaction_1.text: Tnak! Almost got hit by giblets! Glad we rigged that up, eh?
AD_ExplosionReaction_1.context: NodeContext: Tnak is a goblin curse - similar to 'damn!' Pronounced tuh-NACK. An explosion just went off nearby, killing a captive (the source of the giblets). Amused and surprised rather than shocked, with a laugh after or on 'giblets' pleased the trap they 'rigged' worked.

AD_ExplosionReaction_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
AD_ExplosionReaction_0.text: I ain't cleanin' up that mess though.
AD_ExplosionReaction_0.context: NodeContext: looking at the gory aftermath of an explosive trap - passing the buck on cleaning up the guts

AD_CageOpen_0.speaker: Brakkal
AD_CageOpen_0.context: NodeContext: Quietly dismayed/resigned - you've just opened Brakkal's cage, which he knows is rigged to explode when tampered with.

AD_ReleasedReaction_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
AD_ReleasedReaction_0.text: Oi! Heretics belong in cages or in pieces. Kill 'em, lads!
AD_ReleasedReaction_0.context: NodeContext: noticing that players havefreed a caged heretic - everything before 'Kill 'em, lads!' is shouted at players who may be a few feet away. 'Kill 'em, lads!' is a call for backup to any nearby goblins
